stadium.name: The Sun-Baked Bowl
stadium.description: A simple, deep bowl dug from clay and sandstone on the edge of a caravan oasis. The heat is oppressive, and the 'stands' are just blankets laid on the sun-baked dunes.

stats.pregame_ritual: Eating a piece of honeycomb to 'sweeten' their victory.
Smelling a piece of burnt wood from a campfire.
Methodically tearing a large leaf into tiny, identical pieces.
Trying to teach a stray dog a complicated and useless new trick.
Humming a tune they believe only they know.
Tugging on their left earlobe three times.
Shaving one half of their mustache for important games.
Consulting a folk rhyme about the weather to predict the game's outcome.
Sticking a specific type of feather in their helmet's plume.
Organizing a small betting pool on who will score first.
Dipping their hands in a bucket of ice-cold well water.

Methodically tearing a large leaf into tiny, identical pieces.

Sticking a specific type of feather in their helmet's plume.

stadium.name: The Unruly Yard
stadium.description: A field in the center of the city's most rebellious district. The stadium is covered in graffiti, the crowd is hostile, and riots are a common post-game (and mid-game) event.

stats.pregame_ritual: Drinking a shot of hot gravy from a dented tin cup.
Arranging their gear in a perfect, aesthetically pleasing spiral.
Testing the heft of their weapon with a series of slow, deliberate swings.
Kissing the Trollball on its stitched 'nose'.
Reviewing hand signals for secret plays.
Refusing to step on any lines on the field before the whistle blows.
Telling a terrible joke to the Trollball to 'loosen it up'.
Dipping their hands in a bucket of ice-cold well water.
Slapping their own helmet until their ears ring.
Singing a sea shanty completely out of tune.
Reciting a short, epic poem about a past victory.
Telling a terrible joke to the Trollball to 'loosen it up'.
Dipping their hands in a bucket of ice-cold well water.
Slapping their own helmet until their ears ring.
Singing a sea shanty completely out of tune.
Testing the heft of their weapon with a series of slow, deliberate swings.
Reciting a short, epic poem about a past victory.
Kissing the Trollball on its stitched 'nose'.

preGame:
Greetings and salutations, you ghouls, ghosts, and glorious sports fans! This is your favorite voice of the void, Nok the Corrupter, coming to you live from the edge of the Great Desert! Can you feel that heat? No, it is not just the eternal fires of my home plane—it is the opening salvo of the Trollball Playoffs! We are here at the Sun-Baked Bowl where the Desert Spectres are hosting the New Monteforte Chaos Creatures in a Best-of-Three series that promises more bruises than a fallen crate of apples! The atmosphere is electric, though that might just be the static from the impending sandstorm!

On the home side, the Desert Spectres are looking cool as cucumbers despite the oppressive sun. I just saw Steve—yes, the Halberd-wielding powerhouse herself—running a betting pool on who gets their teeth knocked out first! Talk about initiative! Meanwhile, Fidellia Mozelle is over there sniffing a piece of burnt wood like it is a fine perfume. Whatever gets your blood pumping for the carnage, I always say! They are playing in Geth’s backyard, and you know the Gravelord loves a good show. Let us hope they don't disappoint the big guy!

Across the field, the Chaos Creatures are living up to their name! Fogel Raynold is currently slapping his own helmet so hard his ears must be ringing like a cathedral bell, and Lian Denton just downed a shot of hot gravy from a dented tin cup! Hot gravy in this heat? That is the kind of madness I love to see! They are representing the White Ravens today, though I doubt Dame Terra Monteforte’s dirt magic can save them if they can’t handle the dehydration. They look rowdy, they look illiterate, and they look ready to spill some O-positive on the sandstone!

This is the playoffs, folks! The winner takes a massive step toward glory, and the loser? Well, they get a one-way ticket to the losers' bracket and a very long, very hot walk home. The stands are packed with blankets on the dunes, the water is scarce, and the violence is guaranteed. Grab your refreshing beverages and hold onto your hats, because it is time for some TROLLBALL!
postGame:
Holy smoke and brimstone, what a dominant display of desert power! The Desert Spectres have absolutely scorched the New Monteforte Chaos Creatures with a 4-0 shutout that was as brutal as it was beautiful! The Chaos Creatures started with plenty of spit and vinegar, with Mouldon Earl snatching up the Trollball right at the whistle, but the Spectres' defense was a wall of pure sandstone! Steve might have missed an early tackle on Tucker Hett, but she was just getting warmed up for the mayhem to follow!

The first half was a masterclass in 'hit them until they stop moving.' Eileen Mikihisa sent a clear message by tackling Boulanger Procto so hard he had to be carted off the field early! Not to be outdone, Steve intercepted a wild pass from Tucker Hett, turning the tide of momentum faster than a desert wind. Then came the scoring clinic! Heyes Iver, tugging on that earlobe for luck, launched a magnificent shot from the 2-point zone to put the Spectres on the board. Shortly after, Fidellia Mozelle followed up with a center-field strike that sailed right into the basket. 4-0 before the halftime snacks were even served!

I have to tell you, the Chaos Creatures looked like they were suffering from major heatstroke out there. Before the break, Steve and Angelita Darce went on a rampage, injuring Tucker Hett and Mouldon Earl in rapid succession! It was a symphony of crunching bones and clanging armor! Dame Terra Monteforte's favorites looked less like warriors and more like sun-baked raisins by the time the whistle blew. Even the rowdy fans from New Monteforte were silenced by the sheer physicality of the Spectres!

After the halftime healing, the Chaos Creatures tried to mount a comeback. Fogel Raynold, perhaps fueled by that pre-game gravy, went on a vengeful tear! He managed to lay out both Heyes Iver and Lovash Marius, sending them to the sidelines for a dirt nap. It was the kind of gritty, disgusting play that warms my corrupt little heart! For a moment, it looked like the Chaos Creatures might actually find the goal, but the Spectres' resilience is something to behold!

Muscolo Jaehne quickly retaliated for the Spectres, absolutely leveling Urata Oriana and adding another name to the injury list. The Chaos Creatures tried some fancy passing between Urata and Placido Kora, but it was all for naught. Every time they got close to scoring, the Spectres' front line turned into a meat grinder. Huesman Ring was a particular menace, dipping his hands in ice water during the breaks only to deliver blistering hits on Raouf Dragone and Gabriele Klehm!

By the end of the match, the Chaos Creatures were stumbling around like they'd spent the afternoon in an open bar without the benefit of the actual alcohol! They had the ball in the Away 2-Point zone multiple times, but Wolbrom Ariella just couldn't find the mark with that scythe. It was miss after miss, while the Spectres just kept the pressure on. The dehydration clearly took its toll on the visitors, who looked like they were chasing mirages instead of the Trollball!

What a way to start the series for the Desert Spectres! Geth the Gravelord must be grinning from ear to ear seeing his associates dominate the field like this. They played with the discipline of a sandstorm and the heat of a forge. The Chaos Creatures, meanwhile, need to find some literacy or at least some better aim before Game 2, or they’ll be heading to the losers' bracket faster than a falling star!

I must say, I expected more from the 'Heroes' of the White Ravens. Colm and his crew usually put up a better fight, but today they were just speed bumps on the road to a Spectres victory. Maybe they spent too much time reciting poems and not enough time practicing their throws! If you're going to lose, at least lose with some style, but being shut out 4-0 is just embarrassing. It's enough to make a demon blush, if I had blood in my face!

So, the Spectres take a 1-0 lead in this Best-of-Three playoff series! They have the momentum, they have the home-field advantage, and they have the sheer brutality required to go all the way. The Chaos Creatures have a lot of soul-searching—and perhaps some actual ball-handling practice—to do before the next match. They need to find a way to crack that Spectres defense or they'll be toast!

Final Score: The Desert Spectres 4, The New Monteforte Chaos Creatures 0! A glorious day for violence, a terrible day for Monteforte's pride, and a swell time for yours truly! Don't go anywhere, fans, because this playoff action is just heating up! This is Nok the Corrupter signing off from the Sun-Baked Bowl. Stay corrupt, stay violent, and keep your eyes on the Trollball!
